data_findings.finding: This is a 2D packing optimization problem: pack Christmas tree-shaped polygons (N=1 to 200) into smallest square bounding box. Score = sum(side^2/n) for n=1 to 200. Lower is better. Target: 68.919154. Best pre-optimized: ~70.676.

Key kernels use: (1) bbox3 C++ optimizer with simulated annealing, (2) fix_direction rotation optimization, (3) pre-optimized CSV datasets, (4) ensemble of multiple solutions picking best per-N configuration.
bbox3.cpp optimizer uses: complex number geometry, simulated annealing, fluid dynamics, hinge pivot, density gradient flow, global boundary tension, and overlap repair cycles.
Previous experiments show pre-optimized solutions are at local optimum - SA, backward propagation, lattice construction, C++ optimizers showed 0 improvement. Need fundamentally different approaches.
